            : Gabon - Education Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This transcript, from the session of the
            Executive Directors of the International Bank for
            Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) and International
            Development Association (IDA) held on Tuesday, June 4, 1968
            covers only the discussion on the Education Project for Gabon.

17916228.subtopic: Population Policies,Education For All,Access & Equity in Basic Education,Teaching and Learning,Tertiary Education

0.cdata!:
academic standards, call, education
            development, education system, labor force, Let, Mba,
            modernization, Population Growth, primary education, public
            schools, rate of population growth, scholarships, schools,
            secondary education, secondary schools, skill levels,
            skilled manpower, teachers, teaching, technical skills

abstracts.cdata!:
The Education Project for Gabon will
            consist of: (i) the construction and equipment of a primary
            teacher training college in Libreville and a new secondary
            school in Port Gentil; (ii) extensions to three secondary
            schools in Franceville, N'Dende and Ovem; (iii) minor
            extensions to two accelerated vocational training centers;
            (iv) a four-year fellowship program for training of Gabonese
            secondary school teachers; and (v) provision of expatriate teachers.

abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed project would consist of:
            (i) the construction and equipment of a primary teacher
            training college in Libreville and a new secondary school in
            Port Gentil; (ii) extensions to three secondary schools in
            Franceville, N'Dende and Ovem; (iii) minor extensions
            to two accelerated vocational training centers; (iv) a
            four-year fellowship program for training of Gabonese
            secondary school teachers; and (v) provision of expatriate teachers.
